person.persName: Lucian Anderson (Graves County, KY, attorney and politician)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Son of John Anderson and Nancy Davenport Anderson in 1846. Married to Ann R. Lockridge Anderson in 1846. Father of Harry C. Anderson, Nancy A. Anderson, Herbert L. Anderson, Robert L. Anderson, Mayes Anderson, and Lillian Anderson. Lived in Mayfield, Kentucky. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Graves Count in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Presidential elector for the Whig Party in 1852. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1855 to 1857. Attorney in Graves County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Served the First Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from 1863 to 1865. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1864. Charged with working with General Eleazer A. Paine to extort citizens in and around Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky in July and August 1864.
